dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] BabesFight.com]
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
The Planet Policy Enforcement
Sent: Monday, March 06, 2006 3:34 PM
To: VanSkl@aol.com; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] BabesFight.com]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] BabesFight.com
Date:         Mon, 6 Mar 2006 09:04:48 EST
From:         VanSkl@aol.com
To:         abuse@theplanet.com



Hi,
I run my own sites and was offered a link exchange by the owner of another
website.  His site is named Babefight.com and, after seeing what is
contained in his members area, I can tell you that it almost completely
material from other similar websites.  Some of it is free samples taken from
other websites, much of it is illegally reposted material from the members
areas of other websites.  I do not believe that he produces any content
himself merely takes from others and then charges for it.  This is despite
the claim on the front of the website that all material is exclusive to him.
Most of the material has had the original owners' web address cropped off of
the pictures and their video clips have been altered with new title cards.

I can name many websites that the material has been taken from if you need
to confirm copyright infringement.  I am in contact with one webmaster now
who will gladly write and confirm that his material has been illegally
reposted and I'm sure that many others would like to know the situation and
get this site closed down.

I have an active subscription to the site now and would be glad to provide
you with any further information or explicit examples that you might need.
I have complained to his card processors as well about his practices.

As I believe that you host his site I hope that there's something that can
be done about these flagrant violations of copyright.

Thanks,
Scott van Sickle
vanskl@aol.com <mailto:vanskl@aol.com>

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.2 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Mozilla - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFEDKrTvK/XpJs6oyURAjYmAKCMFkJFhbIC5mUz8dc9ZSxTT3/jBACfbVmQ
8gG28Sb0PpemdyIEny6Ok0s=
=i523
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
